data.title: Ovulation Predictor Kit
data.statement:
An ovulation predictor kit (OPK) can be used to predict fertility by detecting a rise in the concentration of luteinising hormone (LH). The days before the LH surge, where estrogen levels are elevated, are also considered highly fertile. 

Your task is to write the software for an OPK. It needs to provide the correct output for [[N]] days of measurements. Each day your program receives the measured levels of [[estrogen]] (in pg/ml) and [[LH]] (in mIU/ml). 

If [[LH]] exceeds the threshold of {{50.0 mIU/ml}}, your program should output {{Peak fertility}}. Otherwise, if [[estrogen]] exceeds the threshold of {{100.0 pg/ml}}, your program should output {{High fertility}}. If neither value exceeds the threshold, output {{Low fertility}}. 

However, if {{Peak fertility}} was displayed once, your program's output to further tests on the following days should be {{Stop testing, peak fertility reached!}}

<<Note: Clash of Code is not medical advice. Discuss fertility decisions with your healthcare specialist.>>

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read estrogen:float LH:float
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of days on which measurements are taken.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Two space separated floating point values [[estrogen]] and [[LH]] for the measurements taken on that day.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> The correct program output for that day.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

An ovulation predictor kit (OPK) can be used to predict fertility by detecting a rise in the concentration of luteinising hormone (LH). The days before the LH surge, where estrogen levels are elevated, are also considered highly fertile.

Your task is to write the software for an OPK. It needs to provide the correct output for N days of measurements. Each day your program receives the measured levels of estrogen (in pg/ml) and LH (in mIU/ml).

If LH exceeds the threshold of 50.0 mIU/ml, your program should output Peak fertility. Otherwise, if estrogen exceeds the threshold of 100.0 pg/ml, your program should output High fertility. If neither value exceeds the threshold, output Low fertility.

However, if Peak fertility was displayed once, your program's output to further tests on the following days should be Stop testing, peak fertility reached!

Note: Clash of Code is not medical advice. Discuss fertility decisions with your healthcare specialist.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of days on which measurements are taken.
Next N lines: Two space separated floating point values estrogen and LH for the measurements taken on that day.
Output
N lines: The correct program output for that day.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 30
Example
Input
1
150.3 40.2
Output
High fertility
